issue.title: Allow a service delegate to create a named service
issue.body: Right now the `#[ServiceDelegate]` Attribute can only be used to create explicit object types. However, we should be able to use this pattern to create _any_ value that might be put into a service; including callables, strings, and other scalar types. If we allow a service to be defined by name and then allow a factory to create that named service it should be able to provide functionality for non-object container values.

comment.body: Need to research whether this is actually an issue. I believe this should be supported now.

issue.title: Create test for container factory preparing an interface and having all implementations invoke method

comment.body: I don't think this is actually a problem anymore. Closing this.

issue.title: Create test for container factory preparing an interface and having all implementations invoke method
The `PostAnalysisObserver` should provide access to the analysis options used to create the definition
issue.body: This will require adjusting the API of an existing interface and will have to be completed in a major version upgrade.

comment.body: This is no longer relevant. The Observer systems was replaced with an event based system.

issue.body: This will require adjusting the API of an existing interface and will have to be completed in a major version upgrade.

comment.body: This issue is no longer relevant. In 3.0 the Observer system was replaced entirely with an event based system.

issue.title: The `PreAnalysisObserver` should provide access to the analysis options that will be used
issue.body: This will require adjusting the API of an existing interface and will have to be completed in a major version upgrade.

issue.title: Allow ServiceDelegate to define a list of profiles
Improve ServiceDelegate experience if Service not defined
issue.body: Currently we throw exception if you define a #[ServiceDelegate] with a type that is not already a service. Consider implicitly making this a service to allow bean-style factory.

payload.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

release.body:
## What's Changed
* :sparkles: Support for amphp v3 by @Nek- in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/35
* Use constructor property promotion in ConfigurationBuilder::build by @Mateodioev in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/38
* README, CHANGELOG for 1.0 release by @cspray in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/41

## New Contributors
* @Nek- made their first contribution in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/35
* @Mateodioev made their first contribution in https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/pull/38

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/labrador-kennel/http-cors/compare/0.3.1...1.0.0

commits.message: README, CHANGELOG for 1.0 release (#41)

issue.title: README needs to be updated
issue.body:
I noticed that the readme mentions that PHP 7 is required for this to work... While the next release will be actually 8.1+.

As saying PHP 7 is compatible is _not wrong_ I didn't edit and suggest a straightforward change. I think adding a table may be a good idea.

But I have no clue about what you want to do about this so here is an issue highlighting the problem :) .

repo.name: http-cors
repo.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

repo.name: http-cors
repo.description: Middleware for @amphp http-server to handle CORS requests!

issue.title: Update readme with a note about versions

comment.body: Thanks for putting this together! However, I do not plan on supporting versions on PHP 7 and will be releasing a proper 1.0 series. Please see #41. I didn't intend for this to live as a 0.x release as long as it did. I do not expect the API to change at this point. Thanks again for your assistance in getting this kept up to date!

Update ArrayConfiguration to handle missing keys (#15)

It is possible that not all keys would be provided to the
ArrayConfiguration instance because the end developer wanted to use
browser default values. This was particularly true of the `max_age` key.
The ArrayConfiguration instance now handles when optional keys are not
provided and returns reasonable "null values".

If the ArrayConfiguration does not receive AT LEAST an array with keys
`origin` and `allowed_methods` an exception will be thrown because CORS
doesn't make sense without at least this information.

This addresses issue #6
updates changelog with recent releases and new 0.3 functionality merged in (#16)
Remove homebrewed AsyncTestCase for official amphp lib (#17)
Refactor Configuration::getOrigin -> getOrigins (#18)

Add ConfigurationBuilder API (#11)

* Add spike for ConfigurationBuilder API

* implement ConfigurationBuilder. fixes #7
